intro: Polyosma philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine osman, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
